name: AI Writing Assistant
tagline: Help users write better content faster with AI
overview: Build an AI-powered writing tool that helps users create professional content. This could be email writing, blog post generation, social media content, product descriptions, or general writing assistance. The core value: turn rough ideas into polished writing in seconds.

commonProblems: Professionals spend 2+ hours daily writing emails
Writers face blank page syndrome when starting blog posts
Non-native speakers struggle with professional English
Marketers need product descriptions at scale
Teams lack consistent brand voice across content
validationQuestions: How much time do you spend writing [emails/content] weekly?
What's the hardest part about writing [type of content]?
What tools do you currently use for writing?
Would you pay to write 50% faster with better quality?

suggestedTechniques.use: Core feature - transform user input into polished content
suggestedTechniques.example: System: You are a professional email writer. User: Turn these bullets into a professional email...
Include 2-3 examples of desired output style in prompt

suggestedTechniques.use: Show AI writing in real-time for better UX
suggestedTechniques.example: Use Anthropic's streaming API to display words as generated

suggestedTechniques.use: Pre-built prompts for common use cases
suggestedTechniques.example: Templates: Professional Email, Casual Email, Sales Pitch, etc.

coreFeatures.description: User inputs topic/bullets, AI generates polished content
coreFeatures.implementation: Single API endpoint: input → prompt → Claude → stream output

coreFeatures.description: Choose tone: professional, casual, friendly, persuasive
coreFeatures.implementation: Dropdown → modify system prompt with tone instruction

coreFeatures.description: Edit AI output, regenerate parts, adjust length
coreFeatures.implementation: Rich text editor with 'regenerate' button per paragraph

coreFeatures.description: Pre-built templates: email, blog post, social media, etc.
coreFeatures.implementation: JSON config file with prompt templates
Store in database with user_id, timestamp

userStories: As a sales rep, I want to turn meeting notes into follow-up emails so I can save 30 minutes per email
As a content marketer, I want to generate blog post outlines from topics so I can beat writer's block
As a non-native speaker, I want to improve my English emails so they sound professional
As a product manager, I want to generate product descriptions at scale so I can launch faster

frontend: Rich text editor component (Tiptap or similar)
backend: Prompt builder service (builds prompts from templates + user input)
database: Generation table: id, user_id, input, output, tone, timestamp
Optional: Template table for custom templates

emailGeneration.system: You are a professional email writer. Write clear, concise, professional emails based on user's key points.
emailGeneration.user:
Write a {{tone}} email about:

{{userInput}}

Format:
- Subject line
- Body (2-4 paragraphs)
- Professional closing

blogPostGeneration.system: You are a skilled content writer. Create engaging, well-structured blog posts.
blogPostGeneration.user:
Topic: {{topic}}

Tone: {{tone}}

Generate:
1. Catchy headline
2. Introduction (hook the reader)
3. 3-5 main points with subheadings
4. Conclusion with call-to-action

Length: {{length}} words

successMetrics.description: Minutes saved per writing task vs manual
% of users who use AI for >50% of writing tasks
successMetrics.measurement: Track AI usage vs manual writing

successMetrics.description: Average LLM API cost per content generation

api.optimization: Cache common requests, use Claude Haiku for simple tasks

hosting.database: Vercel Postgres Free tier or Supabase

differentiationIdeas: Focus on specific niche (e.g., only sales emails, not general writing)
Train on user's past writing to match their voice
Integrate with Gmail/Outlook for one-click email generation

technicalChallenges.solution: Use few-shot examples in prompt, or fine-tune model on examples
Aggressive caching, use cheaper models for simple tasks, rate limiting
Generate in sections, or use streaming with progress indicator
